properties.areaDesc: Curry County; Northeast Highlands; Estancia Valley; Quay County; Harding County; Central Highlands; Guadalupe County; Eastern San Miguel County; Far Northeast Highlands
properties.headline: Winter Weather Advisory issued January 16 at 9:57AM MST until January 17 at 8:00AM MST by NWS Albuquerque NM
properties.description:
...WINTER STORM TO BRING HEAVY SNOW TO THE NORTHERN MOUNTAINS AND
A WINTRY MIX TO PORTIONS OF THE EASTERN PLAINS TODAY...TONIGHT
AND INTO FRIDAY...

.A complex winter storm system will bring accumulating snow to
northern New Mexico. The highest snow accumulations will be found
above 7500 feet with accumulations ranging from 6 to 12 inches
and over a foot possible on mountain peaks. Very strong westerly
winds on Friday will also create areas of reduced visibilities in
blowing snow across the northern high terrain. Areas of freezing
rain will be possible across portions of mainly the east central
plains this morning and again this evening. For the latest New
Mexico road conditions call 511 or visit nmroads.com.

* WHAT...Mixed precipitation expected. Total snow accumulations
around 1 inch. Ice accumulations of a glaze to two tenths of an
inch are possible.

* WHERE...Far Northeast Highlands, Northeast and Central
Highlands, Estancia Valley, Harding, Quay, Curry, Guadalupe
and Eastern San Miguel Counties.

* WHEN...Until 8 AM MST Friday.

* IMPACTS...Plan on very slippery road conditions. Black ice will
make roads look wet but they are actually ice covered.

* ADDITIONAL DETAILS...Interstate 25 from the Las Vegas area to
near Raton will be impacted as well as much of Interstate 40
through eastern New Mexico.
properties.instruction:
Slow down and use caution while traveling.

The latest road conditions for New Mexico can be obtained by
calling 5 1 1, 1-800-432-4269, or visiting nmroads.com.

NWSheadline: WINTER WEATHER ADVISORY REMAINS IN EFFECT UNTIL 8 AM MST FRIDAY
